definition:
Let $M$ be a complex manifold. Let $\mathcal{O}$ be the sheaf of germs
of analytic functions (which is a sheaf of rings) and let $\mathcal{F}$
be a sheaf of $\mathcal{O}$-modules. $\mathcal{F}$ is then called an
*analytic sheaf*.

Suppose $X$ is an analytic vector bundle over $M$. Then the sheaf of
germs of analytic sections of $X$ is an analytic sheaf.

The sheaf of germs of meromorphic functions on $M$ is an analytic sheaf.

[9]{} Lars Hörmander. [**]{}, North-Holland Publishing Company, New
York, New York, 1973. Steven G. Krantz. [**]{}, AMS Chelsea Publishing,
Providence, Rhode Island, 1992.
